title: Cell Bender Functionality & Plotting
text: Cell Bender software elimination technical artifacts scRNA-seq/snRNA-seq uses deep generative model unsupervised removal ambient RNA chimeric PCR artifacts. can find info Cell Bender bioRxiv Preprint, GitHub Repo, Documentation. Following completion Cell Bender scCustomize contains couple functions may helpful creating visualizing data Seurat.
code: library(tidyverse) library(patchwork) library(viridis) library(Seurat) library(scCustomize) library(qs)

title: Cell Bender Functionality & Plotting
text: output Cell Bender H5 file styled can read like 10X Genomics H5 file. However, Seurat::Read10X_h5 assumes file contains name prefix. However,Read10X_h5_Multi_Directory can used reading Cell Bender files. contains additional parameters related Cell Bender imports.

title: Cell Bender Functionality & Plotting
text: following typical output directory structure Cell Bender files sub-directory labeled sample name file also prefixed sample name.
code: Parent_Directory ├── sample_01 │   └── sample_01_out_cell_barcodes.csv │   └── sample_01_out_filtered.h5 │   └── sample_01_out.h5 │   └── sample_01_out.log │   └── sample_01_out.pdf └── sample_02 │   └── sample_02_out_cell_barcodes.csv │   └── sample_02_out_filtered.h5 │   └── sample_02_out.h5 │   └── sample_02_out.log │   └── sample_02_out.pdf

title: Cell Bender Functionality & Plotting
text: adjust parameters account cell bender file names directory structure. secondary_path = "" files directly within immediate sub-directory default_10X_path = FALSE 10X outputs. h5_filename = "_out.h5" specifies shared aspect file name part sample name. (Can also specify “_out_filtered.h5” depending file desired).
code: cell_bender_merged <- Read10X_h5_Multi_Directory(base_path = "assets/cell_bender/", secondary_path = "",     default_10X_path = FALSE, h5_filename = "_out.h5", cell_bender = TRUE, merge = TRUE, sample_names = c("WT1",         "WT2"), parallel = TRUE, num_cores = 2)

what: These matrices can then be used to create Seurat objects as desired (can also be used to create other analysis objects)
title: Cell Bender Functionality & Plotting
code: cell_bender_seurat <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = cell_bender_merged, names.field = 1, names.delim = "_")

title: Cell Bender Functionality & Plotting
text: Sometimes can helpful create object contains cell ranger values cell bender values (’ll come ). scCustomize contains helper function Create_CellBender_Merged_Seurat handle object creation one quick step. function assume use cell calling algorithm Cell Ranger modified counts Cell Bender.

what: Read in both sets of data
title: Cell Bender Functionality & Plotting
code: cell_bender_merged <- Read10X_h5_Multi_Directory(base_path = "assets/cell_bender/", secondary_path = "",     default_10X_path = FALSE, h5_filename = "_out.h5", cell_bender = TRUE, merge = TRUE, sample_names = c("WT1",         "WT2"), parallel = TRUE, num_cores = 2)  cell_ranger_merged <- Read10X_h5_Multi_Directory(base_path = "assets/cell_ranger/", default_10X_path = TRUE,     h5_filename = "filtered_feature_bc_matrix.h5", cell_bender = F, merge = TRUE, sample_names = c("WT1",         "WT2"), parallel = TRUE, num_cores = 2)

title: Cell Bender Functionality & Plotting
text: run function user simply needs provide names two matrices name assay containing Cell Ranger counts (default named “RAW”).
code: dual_seurat <- Create_CellBender_Merged_Seurat(raw_cell_bender_matrix = cell_bender_merged, raw_counts_matrix = cell_ranger_merged,     raw_assay_name = "RAW")

title: Cell Bender Functionality & Plotting
text: Users can specify additional parameters normally passed Seurat::CreateSeuratObject using function.
code: dual_seurat <- Create_CellBender_Merged_Seurat(raw_cell_bender_matrix = cell_bender_merged, raw_counts_matrix = cell_ranger_merged,     raw_assay_name = "RAW", min_cells = 5, min_features = 200)

text: scCustomize includes function Add_Cell_Bender_Diff help process. function take nCount nFeature statistics assays object calculate difference return 2 new columns (“nCount_Diff” “nFeature_Diff”) object meta.data.
code: astrocytes_cortex <- Add_Cell_Bender_Diff(seurat_object = astrocytes_cortex, raw_assay_name = "RAW",     cell_bender_assay_name = "RNA")  head(astrocytes_cortex@meta.data, 5)

title: Cell Bender Functionality & Plotting

code: median_stats <- Median_Stats(seurat_object = astrocytes_cortex, group_by_var = "orig.ident", median_var = c("nCount_Diff",     "nFeature_Diff"))

title: Customized Color Palettes & Themes
text: default Seurat ggplot2 plots work well can often enhanced customizing color palettes theming options used. simplify/streamline process end users scCustomize contains number shortcut helper functions quick access color palettes themes frequently used.
code: # Load Packages library(tidyverse) library(patchwork) library(scCustomize)  pbmc <- pbmc3k.SeuratData::pbmc3k.final

title: Customized Color Palettes & Themes
text: scCustomize number quick helpers access palettes viridis package. information viridis palettes see Intro Viridis package vignette. viridis_plasma_dark_high viridis_plasma_light_high viridis_magma_dark_high viridis_magma_light_high viridis_inferno_dark_high viridis_inferno_light_high viridis_dark_high viridis_light_high palettes provided better contrast continuous palettes. scCustomize default viridis_plasma_dark_high

title: Customized Color Palettes & Themes
text: function DiscretePalette_scCustomize function inspired modified Seurat::DiscretePalette. hood palettes called using paletteer package call palettes without adding package dependencies. following palettes can specified: alphabet (24) alphabet2 (24) glasbey (32) polychrome (36) stepped (24) ditto_seq (40) varibow (Dynamic)

what: Palettes can either be saved to global environment as variable or called directly within other functions:
title: Customized Color Palettes & Themes
code: # Save as variable to global environment polychrome_pal <- DiscretePalette_scCustomize(num_colors = 36, palette = "polychrome")  # Call within another function DimPlot(object = obj_name, cols = DiscretePalette_scCustomize(num_colors = 26, palette = "polychrome"))

what: The “polychrome” palette is the new default for plots with <36 levels and “varibow” when more than 36 levels
title: Customized Color Palettes & Themes
code: DimPlot_scCustom(seurat_object = pbmc)

title: Customized Color Palettes & Themes
text: visualize palettes can use PalettePlot function.
code: PalettePlot(palette = DiscretePalette_scCustomize(num_colors = 26, palette = "alphabet"))  PalettePlot(palette = c("color1", "color2", ...)

title: Customized Color Palettes & Themes
text: Among discrete palettes provide “varibow” palette actually dynamic palette whose colors adjust across rainbow according num_colors provided:

title: Customized Color Palettes & Themes
text: Sometimes can helpful use different order discrete palettes depending end plot generated (can especially true “varibow” sometimes). DiscretePalette_scCustomize optional parameter randomly shuffle returned palette (see shuffle_pal seed parameter allow reproducible shuffling.)
code: PalettePlot(palette = DiscretePalette_scCustomize(num_colors = 30, palette = "varibow")) + ggtitle("varibow (normal)") PalettePlot(palette = DiscretePalette_scCustomize(num_colors = 30, palette = "varibow"), shuffle_pal = TRUE) +     ggtitle("varibow (shuffled)")

title: Customized Color Palettes & Themes
text: Finally scCustomize contains shortcuts shorter discrete palettes can useful plotting groups, treatments, genotypes, etc.

title: Plotting #1: Analysis Plots
text: default plots Seurat packages often good often modified original outputs plotting. scCustomize seeks simplify process enhance default visualizations. Even simple things like adding two ggplot2 themeing options every plot can simplified end user (enhance reproducibility code errors) wrapping inside new function. tutorial, utilizing microglia data Marsh et al., 2020 (bioRxiv) mouse microglia (Figure 1) referred marsh_mouse_micro human post-mortem snRNA-seq (Figure 3) referred marsh_human_pm addition pbmc3k dataset SeuratData package. ’ll add random meta data variables pbmc data form use vignette
code: library(tidyverse) library(patchwork) library(viridis) library(Seurat) library(scCustomize) library(qs)  # Load bioRxiv datasets marsh_mouse_micro <- qread(file = "assets/marsh_2020_micro.qs") marsh_human_pm <- qread(file = "assets/marsh_human_pm.qs")  # Load pbmc dataset pbmc <- pbmc3k.SeuratData::pbmc3k.final pbmc$sample_id <- sample(c("sample1", "sample2", "sample3", "sample4", "sample5", "sample6"), size = ncol(pbmc),     replace = TRUE) pbmc$treatment <- sample(c("Treatment1", "Treatment", "Treatment3", "Treatment4"), size = ncol(pbmc),     replace = TRUE)

code: # For demonstration purposes we can set `species = mouse` for this object of human cells pbmc <- Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = pbmc, species = "mouse") ## Error in Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = pbmc, species = "mouse"): No Mito or Ribo features found in provided object using patterns/feature list provided.  Please check pattern/feature list and/or gene names in object. # Or if providing custom patterns/lists and features not found pbmc <- Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = pbmc, species = "other", mito_pattern = "^MT-", ribo_pattern = "BAD_PATTERN") ## Warning in Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = pbmc, species = "other", : No ## Ribo features found in provided object using pattern/feature list provided. No ## column will be added to meta.data pbmc <- Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = pbmc, species = "human") ## Error in Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = pbmc, species = "human"): Columns with percent_mito and/or percent_ribo already present ##   in meta.data slot. ##   *To run function and overwrite columns set parameter `overwrite = TRUE` or change respective 'mito_name', 'ribo_name', or mito_ribo_name'*.

title: General Helpers & Utilities
text: Gene_Present fairly basic function check feature exists data. can used Seurat LIGER objects well generic data formats (Matrix, data.frame, tibble). addition warning messages Gene_Present returns list 3 entries run: found_features: features found data. bad_features: features found data. bad_features > 0 Gene_Present convert gene listbad_features` upper case sentence case check possible features see wrong case provided. Now let’s look output:
code: # Example gene list with all examples (found genes, wrong case (lower) and misspelled (CD8A # forgetting to un-shift when typing 8)) gene_input_list <- c("CD14", "CD3E", "Cd4", "CD*A")  genes_present <- Gene_Present(data = pbmc, gene_list = gene_input_list) ## Warning in Gene_Present(data = pbmc, gene_list = gene_input_list): The following ## features were omitted as they were not found: Cd4 and CD*A ## Warning in Gene_Present(data = pbmc, gene_list = gene_input_list): NOTE: However, the following features were found: CD4. ##         Please check intended case of features provided. genes_present ## $found_features ## [1] "CD14" "CD3E" ##  ## $bad_features ## [1] "Cd4"  "CD*A" ##  ## $wrong_case_found_features ## [1] "CD4"

title: General Helpers & Utilities
text: default Gene_Present 3 sets warnings/messages prints console finds issues. using function wrapped inside function prefer messages can toggled using optional parameters. case_check_msg prints list features alternate case features found data. omit_warn prints warning list features found data. print_msg prints message features gene_list found data.

code: # For single object data_mod <- Replace_Suffix(data = raw_data, current_suffix = "-1", new_suffix = "-2")  # For list of objects containing same suffix raw_data_list <- list(raw_data1, raw_data2, raw_data3, ..., raw_data10)  new_suffixes <- c("-1", "-2", "-3", ..., "-10")  data_mod <- Replace_Suffix(data = raw_data_list, current_suffix = "-1", new_suffix = new_suffixes)   # For list of objects containing different suffixes raw_data_list <- list(raw_data1, raw_data2, raw_data3, ..., raw_data10)  old_suffixes <- c("-A", "-B", "-C", ..., "-J") new_suffixes <- c("-1", "-2", "-3", ..., "-10")  data_mod <- Replace_Suffix(data = raw_data_list, current_suffix = old_suffixes, new_suffix = new_suffixes)

title: General Helpers & Utilities
text: scCustomize 3 functions facilitate changing type delimiters present cell barcodes. Change_Delim_Prefix Change just suffix delimiter. Change_Delim_Suffix Change just prefix delimiter. Change_Delim_All Change delimiters. functions take identical inputs can applied either single matrix/data.frames lists matrices/data.frames.
code: data_mod <- Change_Delim_Prefix(data = raw_data, current_delim = ".", new_delim = "_")  data_mod <- Change_Delim_Suffix(data = raw_data, current_delim = ".", new_delim = "_")  data_mod <- Change_Delim_All(data = raw_data, current_delim = ".", new_delim = "_")

title: Plotting #4: Iterative Plotting Functions
text: Often times creating large numbers plots (either individual files single PDF) part normal workflow. process can simplified creating plots looping functions. scCustomize simplifies process allowing creation many plots multiple formats self-contained loop functions.

title: Plotting #4: Iterative Plotting Functions
text: Iterate_PC_Loading_Plots: Plots PC Heatmap Top Loading Genes specified number PCs. Iterate_FeaturePlot_scCustom: FeaturePlot_scCustom genes gene list. See Marker Identification Vignette special use case named vector gene lists. Iterate_VlnPlot: Plots VlnPlot genes gene list. Iterate_Plot_Density_Custom Plots single gene density plots genes gene list. Iterate_Plot_Density_Joint Plots joint density plots vectors genes list vectors. Iterate_DimPlot_bySample: Plots DimPlot one sample time. Iterate_Cluster_Highlight_Plot: Plots Cluster_Highlight_Plot clusters given object. Iterate_Meta_Highlight_Plot Plots Meta_Highlight_Plot levels within given meta data column.

title: Plotting #4: Iterative Plotting Functions
text: functions begin Iterate_ shared parameters used dictate file location, file name, file type. *exception Iterate_PC_Loading_Plots slightly different (see manual entry info.) file_path: path directory save file (can also include file prefix desired) file_name: file name (saving single file) suffix add file name (saving individual files meta data variable gene part file name automatically) file_type: accepts one following options: “.pdf”, “.png”, “.tiff”, “.jpeg”, “.svg”. single_pdf: logical. Whether save plots single PDF file vs. one file per variable/gene. dpi: Dots per inch (relevant non vector based file formats).

title: LIGER Plotting & Functionality
text: majority scCustomize’s current functionality Seurat Objects functions working LIGER objects . tutorial, utilizing microglia data Marsh et al., 2020 (bioRxiv) converted LIGER object.
code: # Load Packages library(tidyverse) library(patchwork) library(Seurat) library(rliger) library(scCustomize) library(qs) # read object marsh_micro <- qread("assets/marsh_2020_micro.qs")  # Convert to liger marsh_liger <- rliger::seuratToLiger(objects = marsh_micro, combined.seurat = TRUE, use.idents = T,     use.tsne = T, meta.var = "orig.ident", remove.missing = FALSE)  # Add meta data to LIGER \@cell.data slot marsh_liger@cell.data$Transcription <- marsh_micro@meta.data$Transcription marsh_liger@cell.data$Method <- marsh_micro@meta.data$Method marsh_liger@cell.data$Batch <- marsh_micro@meta.data$Batch marsh_liger@cell.data$Transcription_Method <- marsh_micro@meta.data$Transcription_Method

title: LIGER Plotting & Functionality

code: DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger)

title: LIGER Plotting & Functionality
text: Unfortunately, liger/rliger package properly store name dimensionality reduction technique used labels plots tSNE1/tSNE2 dr1/dr2. DimPlot_LIGER solves providing extra parameter function can used set labels. first time use DimPlot_LIGER R session print one-time message alerting fact parameter exists set “UMAP” default (seems commonly used method currently). However, analysis object used tSNE let’s change parameter.
code: DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE")

title: LIGER Plotting & Functionality
text: DimPlot_LIGER adds number options present liger plotting modifies naming/functionality others -line Seurat ease use.

text: User can specify different color palettes plot
code: DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE", combination = T) clu_color <- ColorBlind_Pal() sample_color <- DiscretePalette_scCustomize(num_colors = 12, palette = "alphabet")  DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE", combination = T, colors_use_cluster = clu_color,     colors_use_meta = sample_color)

title: LIGER Plotting & Functionality
text: DimPlot_LIGER supports grouping splitting plots meta data variables cluster return patchwork layout
code: DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE", group_by = "Transcription_Method",     colors_use_meta = JCO_Four()) DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE", group_by = "Cluster", split_by = "Transcription_Method",     label = FALSE)

title: LIGER Plotting & Functionality
text: DimPlot_LIGER supports many different modifications cluster labels. NOTE: labeling supported plotting cluster. label logical. Whether label clusters plot. label_size Change label text size. label_repel logical. Whether repel labels. label_box logical. Whether place box around label. label_color change label text color.
code: DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE") DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE", label = FALSE) DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE", label_repel = TRUE) DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE", label_repel = TRUE, label_box = TRUE,     label_size = 3)

code: DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE", raster = FALSE, label = FALSE) DimPlot_LIGER(liger_object = marsh_liger, reduction_label = "tSNE", raster = TRUE, label = FALSE)

title: LIGER Plotting & Functionality
text: liger/rliger package already contains function seuratToLiger convert LIGER objects Seurat Objects. However, transfer things issues crop : meta data except “dataset” column liger_object@cell.data lost. Seurat dimensionality reduction set tSNE regardless method used LIGER analysis Seurat assay name specified scCustomize contains modified version function named Liger_to_Seurat solves issues 3 extra parameters: keep_meta logical. Whether keep meta data @cell.data slot LIGER object. Default TRUE. reduction_label Name dimensionality reduction technique used (e.g., tSNE, UMAP, etc). Ensures dim names set correctly Seurat object. seurat_assay Name assay use data Seurat object. Default “RNA”.
code: seurat_obj <- Liger_to_Seurat(liger_object = liger_object, reduction_label = "UMAP")

title: Marker Identification & Cluster Annotation Helpers
text: run FindAllMarkers like normal, output. Seurat::FindAllMarkersreturns percent cells identity 1 (pct.1) identity 2 (pct.2) express marker can helpful view difference two measures addition values alone. scCustomize contains helper function: Add_Pct_Diff add percent difference two clusters. Add_Pct_Diff can used output Seurat, SeuratWrappers, DE tests can piped function .
code: # Run basic FindAllMarkers DE test all_markers <- FindAllMarkers(object = pbmc, verbose = F)  all_markers <- all_markers %>%     group_by(cluster) %>%     arrange(desc(avg_log2FC)) %>%     arrange(cluster)

title: Plotting #2: QC Plots
text: One first steps scRNA-seq analyses performing number QC checks plots data can appropriately filtered. scCustomize contains number functions can used quickly easily generate relevant QC plots. tutorial, utilizing HCA bone marrow cell data SeuratData package.
code: library(tidyverse) library(patchwork) library(Seurat) library(scCustomize) library(qs)  # Load Example Dataset hca_bm <- hcabm40k.SeuratData::hcabm40k  # Add pseudo group variable just for this vignette hca_bm@meta.data$group[hca_bm@meta.data$orig.ident == "MantonBM1" | hca_bm@meta.data$orig.ident ==     "MantonBM2" | hca_bm@meta.data$orig.ident == "MantonBM3" | hca_bm@meta.data$orig.ident == "MantonBM4"] <- "Group 1"  hca_bm@meta.data$group[hca_bm@meta.data$orig.ident == "MantonBM5" | hca_bm@meta.data$orig.ident ==     "MantonBM6" | hca_bm@meta.data$orig.ident == "MantonBM7" | hca_bm@meta.data$orig.ident == "MantonBM8"] <- "Group 2"

what: Add Mitochondrial and Ribosomal Gene Percentages
title: Plotting #2: QC Plots
text: scCustomize contains easy wrapper function automatically add Mitochondrial Ribosomal count percentages meta.data slot. using mouse, human, marmoset data need specify species parameter. NOTE: analogous function LIGER objects (see: Add_Mito_Ribo_LIGER) QC plotting functions currently support Seurat objects. However custom prefixes can used non-human/mouse/marmoset species different annotations. Simply specify species = supply feature lists regex patterns species interest.NOTE: desired please submit issue GitHub additional default species. Please include regex pattern list genes mitochondrial ribosomal genes add additional built-defaults function.
code: # These defaults can be run just by providing accepted species name hca_bm <- Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = hca_bm, species = "Human") # Using gene name patterns hca_bm <- Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = hca_bm, species = "other", mito_pattern = "regexp_pattern",     ribo_pattern = "regexp_pattern")  # Using feature name lists mito_gene_list <- c("gene1", "gene2", "etc") ribo_gene_list <- c("gene1", "gene2", "etc") hca_bm <- Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = hca_bm, species = "other", mito_features = mito_gene_list,     ribo_features = ribo_gene_list)  # Using combination of gene lists and gene name patterns hca_bm <- Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = hca_bm, species = "Human", mito_features = mito_gene_list,     ribo_pattern = "regexp_pattern")

title: Plotting #2: QC Plots
text: scCustomize number quick QC plotting options ease use.NOTE: scCustomize plotting functions contain ... parameter allow user supply parameters original Seurat function used hood.

title: Plotting #2: QC Plots
text: scCustomize contains 4 functions wrap Seurat::VlnPlot(). QC_Plots_Genes Plots genes per cell/nucleus. QC_Plots_UMIs Plots UMIs per cell/nucleus. QC_Plots_Mito Plots mito% (named “percent_mito”) per cell/nucleus. QC_Plots_Feature Plots “feature” per cell/nucleus. Using parameter feature allow plotting applicable named feature object@meta.data slot. scCustomize functions added benefit : Feature plot set default (except QC_Plots_Feature). Added high/low cutoff parameters allow easy visualization potential cutoff thresholds.
code: # All functions contain p1 <- QC_Plots_Genes(seurat_object = hca_bm, low_cutoff = 800, high_cutoff = 5500) p2 <- QC_Plots_UMIs(seurat_object = hca_bm, low_cutoff = 1200, high_cutoff = 45000) p3 <- QC_Plots_Mito(seurat_object = hca_bm, high_cutoff = 20) wrap_plots(p1, p2, p3, ncol = 3)

title: Plotting #2: QC Plots
text: addition able supply Seurat parameters ... plots like many others scCustomize contain additional parameters customize plot output without need post-plot ggplot2 modifications plot_title: Change plot title x_axis_label/y_axis_label: Change axis labels. x_lab_rotate: x-axis label rotated 45 degrees? y_axis_log: y-axis linear log10 scale. Setting y_axis_log can helpful initial plots outliers skew visualization majority data without excluding data setting y-axis limit.
code: p1 <- QC_Plots_UMIs(seurat_object = hca_bm, low_cutoff = 1200, high_cutoff = 45000, pt.size = 0.1) p2 <- QC_Plots_UMIs(seurat_object = hca_bm, low_cutoff = 1200, high_cutoff = 45000, pt.size = 0.1,     y_axis_log = TRUE)  wrap_plots(p1, p2, ncol = 2)

Using parameter feature1 allow plotting applicable named feature object@meta.data slot. QC_Plot_UMIvsFeature Plots UMIs vs. “feature” per cell/nucleus. title: Statistics Functions
text: scCustomize contains couple simple helper functions return metrics interest. vignette utilizing pbmc3k dataset SeuratData package. Now let’s add extra meta data use tutorial
code: # Load Packages library(tidyverse) library(Seurat) library(scCustomize) library(qs)  # Load example dataset for tutorial pbmc <- pbmc3k.SeuratData::pbmc3k.final # Add mito and ribo data pbmc <- Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = pbmc, species = "human")  # Add random sample and group variables pbmc$orig.ident <- sample(c("sample1", "sample2", "sample3", "sample4"), size = ncol(pbmc), replace = TRUE) pbmc@meta.data$group[pbmc@meta.data$orig.ident == "sample1" | pbmc@meta.data$orig.ident == "sample3"] <- "Group 1" pbmc@meta.data$group[pbmc@meta.data$orig.ident == "sample2" | pbmc@meta.data$orig.ident == "sample4"] <- "Group 2"  # Add dummy module score pbmc <- AddModuleScore(object = pbmc, features = list(c("CD3E", "CD4", "THY1", "TCRA")), name = "module_score")

title: Statistics Functions
text: can really helpful know number percentage cells per identity/cluster analysis. scCustomize provides Cluster_Stats_All_Samples function make easy. default Cluster_Stats_All_Samples uses “orig.ident” group variable user can specify @meta.data slot variable.

code: percent_express <- Percent_Expressing(seurat_object = pbmc, features = c("CD4", "CD8A"), threshold = 2)

title: An R package for custom visualization & analyses of single cell sequencing.
text: goals scCustomize : 1. Customize visualizations ease use aesthetic visuals.2. Improve speed/reproducibility common tasks/pieces code scRNA-seq analysis single group functions. scCustomize aims achieve goals : Altering default parameters intuitive plots (least believe plots). instance: FeaturePlot(..., order = TRUE). Wrapping commonly used ggplot2 post-plot themeing function call. copy/paste theme elements every plot (e.g., plot + scale_color_continuous(...) + ggtitle(...) + theme(plot.title = element_text(...), legend.position = ...) + guides(...) Creating new plotting functions either: 1. wrapper around Seurat function parameters already specified (e.g., QC_Plot_Genes) 2. create new plots (e.g., Seq_QC_Plot_Reads_per_Cell Plot_Median_Genes) 3. (e.g., QC_Plot_UMIvsGene(..., combination = TRUE)). Adding additional parameters existing plots inside new function (e.g., high low cutoff parameters QC_Plot_UMIvsGene) scCustomize contains number iterative plotting functions contain extra parameters specify file type, path, name render progress bar console track progress. Returns either single PDF document multiple plots valid file type (e.g., png, tiff, jpeg, pdf, etc). Iterate import functions simplify import process across groups files/samples. Parallelize functions possible allow dramatic speed improvements import large number samples simultaneously. Example adding new parameters: Adding percentage counts aligning mitochondrial (/ribosomal) genes common early step analysis. scCustomize provides Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat (LIGER version) simplify . Basic use requires one line code two parameters. Function already knows defaults Human, Mouse, Marmoset (submit PR like species added!). Example wrapping many lines one: Extracting top 10 (15, 20, 25, etc) genes per identity running FindAllMarkers common scCustomize provides Extract_Top_Markers function simplify process.Using scCustomize function: Instead tidyverse/base R: scCustomize provides checks/warnings wrapped inside functions help provide informative error/warning messages. Two examples include: Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat warn mitochondrial ribosomal features found won’t create new metadata column. Rename_Clusters check make sure right number unique new names provided provide one two error messages attempting rename object idents.
code: Add_Mito_Ribo_Seurat(seurat_object = obj_name, species = "Human") markers_df <- FindAllMarkers(object = obj_name)  # Get vector/string top10_list <- Extract_Top_Markers(marker_dataframe = markers_df)  # or for data.frame top10_df <- Extract_Top_Markers(marker_dataframe = markers_df, dataframe = TRUE) markers_df <- FindAllMarkers(object = obj_name)  # Get vector/string top10_list <- markers_df %>%   rownames_to_column("rownames") %>%   group_by(cluster) %>%   slice_max(n = 10, order_by = avg_log2FC) %>%   pull("gene")  # or for data.frame top10_df <- markers_df %>%   rownames_to_column("rownames") %>%   group_by(cluster) %>%   slice_max(n = 10, order_by = avg_log2FC) %>%   column_to_rownames("rownames")

(default names(H)). renormalize Whether log-normalize raw data using Seurat defaults (default TRUE). use.liger.genes Whether carry variable genes (default TRUE). .dataset Include dataset origin cluster identity Seurat object (default FALSE). reduction_label Name dimensionality reduction technique used.  Enables accurate transfer name Seurat object instead defaulting "tSNE". seurat_assay Name set assay Seurat Object.  Default "RNA". object liger object. keep.meta logical. Whether transfer additional metadata (nGene/nUMI/dataset already transferred) new Seurat Object.  Default TRUE.

what: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X — Read10X_GEO
title: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X — Read10X_GEO
text: Enables easy loading sparse data matrices provided 10X genomics. file prefixes added NCBI GEO repos.

title: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X — Read10X_GEO
code: Read10X_GEO(   data_dir = NULL,   sample_list = NULL,   sample_names = NULL,   gene.column = 2,   cell.column = 1,   unique.features = TRUE,   strip.suffix = FALSE,   parallel = FALSE,   num_cores = NULL )

title: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X — Read10X_GEO
text: data_dir Directory containing matrix.mtx, genes.tsv (features.tsv), barcodes.tsv files provided 10X. sample_list vector file prefixes/names specific samples desired.  Default NULL load samples given directory. sample_names set sample names use sample entry returned list.  NULL set names file name sample. gene.column Specify column genes.tsv features.tsv use gene names; default 2. cell.column Specify column barcodes.tsv use cell names; default 1. unique.features Make feature names unique (default TRUE). strip.suffix Remove trailing "-1" present cell barcodes. parallel logical (default FALSE).  Whether use multiple cores reading data. possible Linux based systems. num_cores parallel = TRUE indicates number cores use multicore processing.

title: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X — Read10X_GEO
text: features.csv indicates data multiple data types, list containing sparse matrix data type returned. Otherwise sparse matrix containing expression data returned.

title: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X — Read10X_GEO
text: Code used function slightly modified Seurat::Read10X function Seurat package (https://github.com/satijalab/seurat) (Licence: GPL-3).  Function modified support file prefixes altered loop Samuel Marsh scCustomize (also previously posted potential PR Seurat GitHub).

title: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X — Read10X_GEO
code: if (FALSE) { data_dir <- 'path/to/data/directory' expression_matrices <- Read10X_GEO(data_dir = data_dir) # To create object from single file seurat_object = CreateSeuratObject(counts = expression_matrices[[1]]) }

title: Load 10X count matrices from multiple directories — Read10X_Multi_Directory
text: Enables easy loading sparse data matrices provided 10X genomics present multiple subdirectories.  Can function either default output directory structure Cell Ranger custom directory structure.

title: Load 10X count matrices from multiple directories — Read10X_Multi_Directory
code: Read10X_Multi_Directory(   base_path,   secondary_path = NULL,   default_10X_path = TRUE,   sample_list = NULL,   sample_names = NULL,   parallel = FALSE,   num_cores = NULL,   merge = FALSE,   ... )

title: Load 10X count matrices from multiple directories — Read10X_Multi_Directory
text: base_path path parent directory contains subdirectories interest. secondary_path path parent directory count matrix files sample. default_10X_path logical (default TRUE) sets secondary path variable default 10X directory structure. sample_list vector sample directory names specific samples desired.  NULL read subdirectories parent directory. sample_names set sample names use sample entry returned list.  NULL set names subdirectory name sample. parallel logical (default FALSE) whether use multi core processing read matrices. num_cores many cores use parallel processing. merge logical (default FALSE) whether merge samples single matrix return list matrices. ... Extra parameters passed Read10X.

title: Load 10X count matrices from multiple directories — Read10X_Multi_Directory
text: list sparse matrices (merge = FALSE) single sparse matrix (merge = TRUE).

title: Load 10X count matrices from multiple directories — Read10X_Multi_Directory
code: if (FALSE) { base_path <- 'path/to/data/directory' expression_matrices <- Read10X_Multi_Directory(base_path = base_path) }

title: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X in HDF5 file format — Read10X_h5_GEO

title: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X in HDF5 file format — Read10X_h5_GEO
text: data_dir Directory containing matrix.mtx, genes.tsv (features.tsv), barcodes.tsv files provided 10X. sample_list vector file prefixes/names specific samples desired.  Default NULL load samples given directory. sample_names set sample names use sample entry returned list.  NULL set names file name sample. parallel logical (default FALSE).  Whether use multiple cores reading data. possible Linux based systems. num_cores parallel = TRUE indicates number cores use multicore processing.

title: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X in HDF5 file format — Read10X_h5_GEO

title: Load in NCBI GEO data from 10X in HDF5 file format — Read10X_h5_GEO
code: if (FALSE) { data_dir <- 'path/to/data/directory' expression_matrices <- Read10X_h5_GEO(data_dir = data_dir) # To create object from single file seurat_object = CreateSeuratObject(counts = expression_matrices[[1]]) }

text: Enables easy loading sparse data matrices provided 10X genomics present multiple subdirectories.  Can function either default output directory structure Cell Ranger custom directory structure.

title: Load 10X h5 count matrices from multiple directories — Read10X_h5_Multi_Directory
code: Read10X_h5_Multi_Directory(   base_path,   secondary_path = NULL,   default_10X_path = TRUE,   h5_filename = "filtered_feature_bc_matrix.h5",   cell_bender = FALSE,   sample_list = NULL,   sample_names = NULL,   replace_suffix = FALSE,   new_suffix_list = NULL,   parallel = FALSE,   num_cores = NULL,   merge = FALSE,   ... )

title: Load 10X h5 count matrices from multiple directories — Read10X_h5_Multi_Directory
text: base_path path parent directory contains subdirectories interest. secondary_path path parent directory count matrix files sample. default_10X_path logical (default TRUE) sets secondary path variable default 10X directory structure. h5_filename name h5 file (including .h5 suffix).  h5 files name (.e. Cell Ranger output) use full file name.  default function uses Cell Ranger name: "filtered_feature_bc_matrix.h5". h5 files sample specific prefixes (.e. Cell Bender) use shared part file name (e.g., "_filtered_out.h5"). cell_bender logical (default FALSE).  h5 file cell bender output, needed set correct file names. sample_list vector sample directory names specific samples desired.  NULL read subdirectories parent directory. sample_names set sample names use sample entry returned list.  NULL set names subdirectory name sample. replace_suffix logical (default FALSE).  Whether replace barcode suffixes matrices using Replace_Suffix. new_suffix_list vector new suffixes replace existing suffixes replace_suffix = TRUE. See Replace_Suffix information.  remove suffixes set new_suffix_list = "". parallel logical (default FALSE) whether use multi core processing read matrices. num_cores many cores use parallel processing. merge logical (default FALSE) whether merge samples single matrix return list matrices.  use sample_names parameter add prefix cell barcodes. ... Extra parameters passed Read10X_h5.

what: Load in NCBI GEO data formatted as single file per sample — Read_GEO_Delim

text: Can read delimited file types (.e. csv, tsv, txt)

title: Load in NCBI GEO data formatted as single file per sample — Read_GEO_Delim
code: Read_GEO_Delim(   data_dir,   file_suffix,   move_genes_rownames = TRUE,   sample_list = NULL,   full_names = FALSE,   sample_names = NULL,   barcode_suffix_period = FALSE,   parallel = FALSE,   num_cores = NULL )

title: Load in NCBI GEO data formatted as single file per sample — Read_GEO_Delim
text: data_dir Directory containing files. file_suffix file suffix individual files.  Must across files imported.  used detect files import GEO IDs. move_genes_rownames logical.  Whether gene IDs present first column row names delimited file.  TRUE move first column row names creating final matrix. Default TRUE. sample_list vector samples within directory read (can either without file_suffix see full_names).  NULL read subdirectories. full_names logical (default FALSE).  Whether sample_list vector includes file suffix. FALSE function add suffix based file_suffix parameter. sample_names set sample names use sample entry returned list. NULL set names directory name sample. barcode_suffix_period barcode suffix period changed "-".  Default (FALSE; barcodes left identical format input files.).  TRUE "." barcode suffix changed "-". parallel logical (default FALSE).  Whether use multiple cores reading data. possible Linux based systems. num_cores parallel = TRUE indicates number cores use multicore processing.

title: Load in NCBI GEO data formatted as single file per sample — Read_GEO_Delim
text: List gene x cell matrices list format named sample name.

title: Load in NCBI GEO data formatted as single file per sample — Read_GEO_Delim
code: if (FALSE) { data_dir <- 'path/to/data/directory' expression_matrices <- Read_GEO_Delim(data_dir = data_dir) }

code: Replace_Suffix(data, current_suffix, new_suffix)

title: Replace barcode suffixes — Replace_Suffix
text: data Either matrix/data.frame list matrices/data.frames cell barcodes column names. current_suffix single value vector values representing current barcode suffix. suffix matrices/data.frames list single value required. new_suffix single value vector values representing new barcode suffix added. desired suffix matrices/data.frames list single value required. suffix desired set new_suffix = "".`

Need perform clustering factorization calling function num_genes Number genes display factor (Default 8). colors_use_factors colors use plotting factor loadings  default datasets plotted using "varibow" shuffle = TRUE DiscretePalette_scCustomize. colors_use_dimreduc colors use plotting factor loadings dimensionality reduction coordinates (tSNE/UMAP). Defaults current wd. file_name name suffix append sample name. return_plots logical. Whether return plots environment.  (Default FALSE) cells.highlight Names specific cells highlight plot (black) (default NULL). reorder_datasets New order plot datasets factor plots different current factor level order cell.data slot. ggplot_default_colors logical.  colors_use_factors = NULL, Whether return plot using default ggplot2 "hue" palette instead default "varibow" palette. color_seed random seed palette shuffle colors_use_factors = NULL.  Default = 123.

what: scCustomize: An R package for custom visualization & analyses of single cell sequencing. — scCustomize-package
title: scCustomize: An R package for custom visualization & analyses of single cell sequencing. — scCustomize-package
text: Collection functions created /curated aid visualization analysis single-cell data using R.

title: scCustomize: An R package for custom visualization & analyses of single cell sequencing. — scCustomize-package
text: scCustomize uses following options() configure behavior: scCustomize_warn_raster_iterative Show message setting raster parameter Iterate_FeaturePlot_scCustom raster = FALSE single_pdf = TRUE due large file sizes. scCustomize_warn_raster_LIGER Show warning rasterization points DimPlot_LIGER due new functionality compared LIGER. scCustomize_warn_na_cutoff Show message properly setting na_cutoff parameter FeaturePlot_scCustom. scCustomize_warn_zero_na_cutoff Show message properly setting na_cutoff parameter FeaturePlot_scCustom na_cutoff set exactly zero. scCustomize_warn_vln_raster_iterative Show message Iterate_VlnPlot pt.size > 0 due current lack raster support VlnPlot scCustomize_warn_LIGER_dim_labels Show message DimPlot_LIGER parameter reduction_label LIGER objects store dimensionality reduction name therefore needs set manually. scCustomize_warn_DimPlot_split_type Show message DimPlot_scCustom parameter split.split_seurat alert user difference returned plots scCustomize Seurat. scCustomize_warn_LIGER_dim_labels_plotFactors Show message plotFactors_scCustom parameter reduction_label LIGER objects store dimensionality reduction name therefore needs set manually.

title: scCustomize: An R package for custom visualization & analyses of single cell sequencing. — scCustomize-package
